solution.text:
No. of Orange balls \(=_{m}_\)
No. of Green balls \(=_{l}_\)
Probability of drawing an Orange ball \(=\frac {No.\,of\,orange\,balls}{Total\,balls}\)
\(=\frac {_{m}_}{_{j}_+_{k}_+_{l}_+_{m}_}\)
\(=\frac{_{m}_}{_{{j+k+l+m}}_}=_{{Fraction(m,j+k+l+m)}}_\)
Probability of drawing a Green ball \(=\frac {No.\,of\,green\,balls}{Total\,balls}\)
\(= \frac{_{l}_}{_{j}_+_{k}_+_{l}_+_{m}_}\)
\(=\frac {_{l}_}{_{{j+k+l+m}}_}=_{{Fraction(l,j+k+l+m)}}_\)
Therefore, the probability of drawing of drawing an orange ball is more than that of a green ball

content.text: A bag contains \(_{j}_\) red balls, \(_{k}_\) blue balls, \(_{l}_\) green balls and \(_{m}_\) orange balls (The balls are identical in all respects other than color). A single ball is drawn at random, is the probability of drawing an orange ball more than that of a green ball?
